definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Sichuan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4])
flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
(bird species of China) lowland white-eye (Zosterops meyeni)
throwing the embroidered ball (traditional Zhuang flirting game at festivals)/(fig.) to make overtures/to court

sentences.english: The artistic achievements of Xiuruji mostly embody two aspects.
sentences.chinese: 《繡襦記》的藝術成就主要體現在兩方面。

sentences.english: Silvereyes are omnivorous but have a particular fondness for fruit.
sentences.chinese: 灰胸繡眼鳥是雜食性的但是尤其喜愛食用植物的果實。

sentences.english: Shou was bestowed by Empress Dowager Cixi when she presented the Empress with the embroidered tapestry, Eight Immortals Celebrating Birthday.
sentences.chinese: 壽被賦予慈溪太后她皇后繡掛毯，八老慶祝生日。

sentences.english: Among the Basic techniques are cross-stitch, crewel work, and quilting.
sentences.chinese: 最基本的技巧是十字針鏽和絎縫繡。

sentences.english: Dragon robe is the emperor's court dress embroidered with dragon patterns.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝的朝服，上面繡着龍形圖案。

sentences.english: Was very quick and then passed by for a daytime, the Lan Hui also achieved embroidering a sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 一天很快就過去了，瀾惠也繡完了一隻袖子。

sentences.english: You can't work a fine pattern with a thick needle and wool.
sentences.chinese: 你不能用粗針和毛線繡那樣細的圖案。

sentences.english: The Queen asked the Countess what she was embroidering.
sentences.chinese: 女王問伯爵夫人正在繡什麼。

sentences.english: Gently the willow fluff wafts to the embroidered screen.
sentences.chinese: 遊絲軟系飄春榭，落絮輕沾撲繡簾。

sentences.english: Direct embroidered on clothes, how Dage it?
sentences.chinese: 直接繡在衣服上，怎麼打格呢？

sentences.english: Had dI the heavens' embroidered cloths, inwrought with golden and silver light.
sentences.chinese: 假若我有天神的繡袍，鑲嵌着金光和銀光。

sentences.english: I look back Chang'an hilltop embroidered in multicolor.
sentences.chinese: 長安回望繡成堆，山頂千門次第開。

sentences.english: Adding embroidered whiskers to your animal face purse is a great detail.
sentences.chinese: 繡晶須添加到您的獸面錢包是一個偉大的細節。

sentences.english: The design can be worked in cross stitch.
sentences.chinese: 這個圖案可以用十字針法繡出來。

sentences.english: The dwarf seahorses, or Hippocampus zosterae, are particularly ill-suited to escape.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是侏儒海馬或繡眼海馬不會逃脫災害。

sentences.english: Air curtain embroidered open several households.

definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
to fold/to fold over in layers/to furl/to layer/to pile up/to repeat/to duplicate
